commands.name: az network routeserver peering create
commands.syntax:
az network routeserver peering create --name
                                      --resource-group
                                      --routeserver
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--peer-asn]
                                      [--peer-ip]
examples: az network routeserver peering create -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer -n MyRouteServerPeer --peer-asn 11000 --peer-ip 10.0.0.120

commands.name: az network routeserver peering delete
commands.syntax:
az network routeserver peering delete [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--routeserver]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--yes]
examples: az network routeserver peering delete -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer -n MyRouteServerPeer -y

commands.name: az network routeserver peering list
commands.summary: List all route server peerings under a resource group.
examples: az network routeserver peering list -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer

commands.name: az network routeserver peering list-advertised-routes
commands.summary: List all routes the route server bgp connection is advertising to the specified peer.
commands.syntax:
az network routeserver peering list-advertised-routes [--ids]
                                                      [--name]
                                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                      [--resource-group]
                                                      [--routeserver]
                                                      [--subscription]
examples: az network routeserver peering list-advertised-routes -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer -n MyRouteServerPeer

commands.name: az network routeserver peering list-learned-routes
commands.summary: List all routes the route server bgp connection has learned.
commands.syntax:
az network routeserver peering list-learned-routes [--ids]
                                                   [--name]
                                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                   [--resource-group]
                                                   [--routeserver]
                                                   [--subscription]
examples: az network routeserver peering list-learned-routes -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer -n MyRouteServerPeer

commands.name: az network routeserver peering show
examples: az network routeserver peering show -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer -n MyRouteServerPeer

commands.name: az network routeserver peering update
commands.syntax:
az network routeserver peering update [--add]
                                      [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--peer-asn]
                                      [--peer-ip]
                                      [--remove]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--routeserver]
                                      [--set]
                                      [--subscription]
examples: az network routeserver peering update -g MyResourceGroup --routeserver MyRouteServer -n MyRouteServerPeer --peer-ip 10.0.0.0

commands.name: az network routeserver peering wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
